attributes.comment:
I am a US citizen living in the Netherlands. I oppose the fee increases and believe
that USCIS should be required to start over in its calculation of fee increases.

While an increase in filing fees may be necessary, it is incredible that USCIS is
planning to increase fees in some cases by approximately 275% (I-485). This is
an extreme fee increase, particularly as many of those affected often have
little money to handle such increase as they already are working hard to start a
new life in the U.S. While many employers will be able to pay the increased fees,
these higher employment costs will undoubtedly be passed on to U.S. consumers
by higher prices.

Moreover, this reflects poor planning and strategy on the part of USCIS at at time
when the United States needs immigrant workers, particularly low-skilled workers
who earn less and have less ability to pay such high filing fees.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Kirsten K. Anderson
